title: Ticket #4071: Provide python bindings for event log reader
description:
CMS has a web server which needs to parse DAGMan's nodes.log but, due to security reasons, isn't allowed to fork/exec "condor_q -userlog".

However, we do have access to the htcondor python module. I propose adding a new htcondor module method, readEvents, which takes in a file pointer and returns a ClassAd iterator.
remarks:
2013-Nov-15 10:32:07 by wenger:
Just a note to summarize some emails that have gone back and forth -- we really don't want to encourage people to parse the nodes.log file. I'm asking Brian if the node status file or jobstate.log file will work for him...

2013-Nov-18 10:53:27 by bbockelm:
Hi,

We figured out a way to use the job log + node state file.

So, this is still needed.

Brian

2013-Dec-17 17:11   Check-in [39032]: minor edit of read_events() doc and add 8.1.3 version history item. #4071 (By Karen Miller )
2013-Nov-20 19:11   Check-in [38786]: Fix compilation issues on Fedora and Mac OS X. #4071. This code now passes its own tests and a test run on NMI. (By Brian Bockelman )
2013-Nov-20 19:10   Check-in [38785]: Revert "Revert "Add python bindings for the event log reader API. #4071"" This reverts commit bfd8e519632dfdd9a98f306a6acd26215d5ddf2f, restoring the API added for #4071; a follow-up will fix NMI build failures. (By Brian Bockelman )
2013-Nov-19 22:37   Check-in [38768]: Revert "Add python bindings for the event log reader API. #4071" Seems to have caused bizarre Mac OS X build failures I can't replicate locally. Will debug and try again in a topic branch. This reverts commit 4943d41ae1d96cafc0dbdc17f4672329cb12213a. (By Brian Bockelman )
2013-Nov-19 21:25   Check-in [38767]: Add python bindings for the event log reader API. #4071 This exposes a new function, read_events, in the htcondor python module. Given a file object, it returns an iterator of ClassAds corresponding to the HTCondor events in that log file. [...] (By Brian Bockelman )
